comments_since_last_sample.body:
It's cool to make discovering not so well known pieces. Somehow, maybe you should take more time to listen the entire  pieces. It should be a good antidote against the zapping  ideology of the commercial music. But, with your help I discovered a new russian composer and I'm grateful for that. 
Pierre from France.
Respighi

sounds like genshin impact when you're fighting 4:25-4:32

The Debussy harp piece was played by our harp major at my college for a concerto/aria competition. It was really good, she was an honorable mention. The winners get to play their piece with our orchestra.
I enjoy this type of video. Thank you!!
Sibelius’ Le Sapin (orig. Kuusi) is one of my favourite piano pieces to play. Pure perfection. Would love to hear it from you guys. Br, a Finn
Love these types of videos.
Is it me or this video quality is the clearest I’ve ever seen on two set and I’m feeling it.

There is a piece that i used to listen to when I was a child starts like African style and it ends with the most beautiful violin- piano speech like one will play and the other will reply. If you know the piece name please tell me so I can find it again <3
Schumann Violin Concerto
My dudes, Kallinikov Symphony 2 is a piece seasoned pros know nothing about. In most cases, they don't even know who Kallinikov is!
